cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.COM. 

The paper discusses lower bounds on the achievable ergodic rate in massive MIMO systems, which are typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and networking (cs.NI) communities. The paper also mentions scenarios where channel hardening is not sufficiently pronounced, such as small scattering angular spread and cell-free massive MIMO, which are topics of interest in the signal processing (cs.SI) and communication (cs.COM) communities. Finally, the paper specifically mentions the use of zero-forcing beamforming, which is a common technique in massive MIMO (cs.MM).
